body:
By default, Go will build with support for calling C code, and on Darwin will call into C code to retrieve the set of trusted root certificates.  This requires you to have xcode installed.

Or, you can build without xcode and without support for calling C code by setting `CGO_ENABLED=0` in the environment.

Closing because there isn't a bug that we can fix.  You may find it easier to ask questions on a forum; see https://golang.org/wiki/Questions .
